title: Amazing Restaurants
name: Amazing Restaurants
description:
A Map by Weave

There are good restaurants, great restaurants and amazing restaurants. These are my faves from my travels.

properties.name: BREAKFAST: Andy's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Weave  29556 Orchard Lake Road, Farmington Hills, MIRun by a former head chef from Yugoslavia, and his wife, Andy\'s is always packed with weekend morning diners looking for a fantastic breakfast. The line usually stretches out the door, and it\'s WORTH IT. Try his homemade pastries, which he used to win awards for in Yugoslavia.

properties.name: DINNER: Metropolitan Grill
properties.description: Posted by Weave820 2nd Ave, Seattle, WAI\'ve dined at Morton\'s in LA and Chicago...this is hands-down my favorite restaurant for a huge, juicy steak. The exquisite taste will blow you away. Afterward, enjoy cigars and martinis at the bar.

properties.name: GAME: Hudson's on the Bend
properties.description: Posted by Weave 3509 FM 620 Rd N, Austin, TXA Lake Country game restaurant, Hudson\'s features venison, wild boar, pheasant, quail along with traditional meat dishes like trout, Black Angus Beef and Smoked Lobster. Never had gourmet game before. All I can say is Oh. My. God.

properties.name: INDIAN: Swami's Mayura
properties.description: Posted by Weave 3201 Jefferson Avenue, Cincinnati, OHKalayan Swami Naidu Sunkara, known as Swami, is a favorite among celebs, who always seem to frequent his restaurant when they come to Cincinnati. His very friendly demeanor and lavish attention can make the timid a little stand-offish, but his food is the best Indian cuisine I\'ve had anywhere in the US or the EU.

properties.name: IRISH BREAKFAST: Ballinalacken Castle Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Weave Roadford, Co. Clare, IrelandIf you can get the room facing the Atlantic, with the fireplace and big canopy bed, you\'ll be in an Irish faerie tale fer sure. The breakfast, unlike so many Irish hotels and B&Bs, was cooked very well indeed, and the view was grand. If you\'re lucky, the proprietor will let you explore the locked castle the next morning.

properties.name: ITALIAN: Sesto Senso
properties.description: Posted by Weave  1214 18th St NW, Washington, DCA classic thumping DC euro-club at night, Sesto is a very warm, cosmopolitan Italian restaurant. Fantastic service and lots of amazing scenery, it\'s my choice for Best Italian. And yes, it blows away Alfredo\'s in NYC.

properties.name: ROMANTIC: The Celestial
properties.description: Posted by Weave1071 Celestial St, Cincinnati, OHAmazing view, award-winning wines and Most Romantic Restaurant as voted by the New York Times and Cincinnati Magazine.

properties.name: Salt Creek Grille
properties.description: Posted by Weave 32802 Pacific Coast Highway, Dana Point, CAEnjoy a cocktail around the outdoor fire pit and then go inside for an amazing mesquite steak. Afterward, walk down to Salt Creek Beach...my idea of a memorable California evening!

properties.name: WESTERN: Wolf Lodge Inn
properties.description: Posted by Weave 12025 E Frontage Road, Coeur d\'Alene, IDFrom RoadFood.com: "A vast red barn-board roadhouse just yards from the highway, The Wolf Lodge Inn is an exuberant wild-west domain. Tables are covered with oilcloth and the walls are packed with trophy animal heads, bleached bovine skulls, antique tools, old beer posters, and yellowing newspaper clippings of local-interest stories. Miscellaneous booths and dining nooks are arrayed in several rooms; at the back of the rearmost dining area is a stone barbecue pit where tamarack and cherrywood burn a few feet below the grate. On this grate sizzle slabs of beef ranging from sixteen-ounce sirloins and filets mignon to porterhouses well over two pounds." From the Splendid Table radio show: "Wolf Lodge Inn is the kind of place Grizzly Adams would take a date. Wonderful salmon and steaks grilled over cherry wood are featured at this roadhouse on Lake Coeur d\'Alene. Expect gigantic portions (how about the 42-ounce Rancher Steak?) accompanied by Buckaroo Beans and the Inn\'s take on fry bread."
